Topic.Title: amazon

Message.Msg: Hey it's been working for them as a non profit for quite some time. It's not like anything I can recall seeing as it's gone on for years. Granted I have only actively been involved with the stock for less than a year but fundamentals have pretty much meant nothing. Timothy Phillips and Paulo Santos have written some excellent articles on SAing which get into all the sordid details of the fundies and how they have been getting worse and worse. The question is when the market will truly care and when the machinations that have pushed this scam valuation to the moon run for the exits. Unfortunately that could be here, above $300 or crazily $100 north of here. Ultimately, the retail investor will get hurt in their 401k's etc and anything that's said super negative, highly publically will only be after the fact when the crooks money is off the tables.

Message.Title: Most Over-Hyped, Over-Valued stock I have analyzed this year
Message.Msg: How can investors sleep at night investing in this stock? Sure the stock has gone up (and good for those who bought), but as Warren Buffett once said "when the tide goes out you find out quickly who is not wearing a bathing suit". My guess is that Amazon's hype subsides in 2014 after they report a few more lackluster quarters and ask analysts and investors to continue to believe in their model versus "actual earnings". I'm quite surprised that the American Funds (one of AMZN's largest stock holders) have stuck with this stock this long. One reason why I'm avoiding buying into any of their funds. Good luck to those owning this stock...I think you 're going to need it over the next year or two.
